subject: Strengthening the incident management and response system of NHAI-reg..
text: "Rah <54 WTTHNf gfeabrut (Tsw qRdev & RTHrf HATT4,  HR TTFT) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) 874 T #ft-5 0 6, 4427-10, ERqM, #f @alt 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 Tn /Phone : 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/ Incident Management/2022 Policy Circular No.18.84/2022 dated 26th October, 2022 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/HO/1033/CallCentre/2018-Part(1) (Comp. No. 110364)} Sub: Strengthening the incident management and response system of NHAI-reg: In order to improve the response time of the Ambulances and ensure the start of treatment of the accidents within the golden hour, the following decisions have been taken based on the recommendations of MoRTH: (a) The ambulances deployed by the civil works Contractor / Concessionaire or through any other contracts for that matter are to be directed to transport the accident victims to the nearest medical care providing facility to ensure minimum delay in start of treatment of the victims_ (b) In case the Ambulances fail to observe directives as stipulated in para (a) above, the ambulance deployment agency shall be fined Rs.10,000/- in first such instance, Rs.25,000/- in second instance and Rs.1,00,000/- in the third instance which shall also be considered as the last warning and  thereafter, the civil works Contractor/ Concessionaire shall be liable for further action as per provisions of their respective contract/concession agreement. The centrally deployed Ambulance Contractor shall be liable for termination on fourth count of such an incident. In case, delay in treatment due to aforesaid mentioned reason leads to death of any victims, the civil works Contractor / Concessionaire shall be liable for debarment for upto 6 months  from participating in all works of NHAI based on the recommendations of concerned RO/PD_ (c) In order to assess the capabilities of the incident management system of NHAI, ROs and PDs are authorised to the Ambulances and EMT staff audited from the concerned District Health Department to comply with the requirements of NHAI policy circular dated 11.03.2021. A request to this effect may be formally made before the concerned District Magistrate during the Road Safety Meetings. The non-compliance with the specifications in their respective contract /concession agreement Or above cited circular (whichever is better) shall be reported to HO Division. (d) Further, in order to strengthen the Incident Management Operations, training of entire staff of Ambulance as well as Highway Surveillance Vehicle in extrication and basics of first responder training for accident victims may be arranged with NDRF. 2 The provisions in para (a) & (b) above may be incorporated in Schedule-C of all future and under bidding projects of NHAI to ensure enforcement of the same without any contention from Contractors/ Concessionaires. As regards the current projects under O&M, an undertaking to above effect may be taken from the Contractors/ Concessionaires in public interest: 3_ This issues with the approval of the Competent Authority.
